page.title: 01OVINGTON AND NEIGHBOURHOOD
page.content: Ovington is a small quiet village having a population of about 130. Many of the old stone built houses are clustered around or near to the village green, although a small numger of modern dwelling have been provided on the edge of the village. The inn and the village hall provide the centres for the community's relaxation and social activities; the post office provides basic village shop commodities. The parish church is about 2 miles away. Ovington is situated in delightfully unspoilt open countryside in which the River Tees is a particularly attractive feature. The land is almost entirely devoted to farming. Most of the land is arable providing grain, oil seed and root crops. However, some grassland caters for sheep and cattle. Many of the population are employed on the land,
